commit message: Added hasActivity() check before requesting more notifications, just to be safe.
Merge tag '2.6.1'
Merge branch 'issue/927-illegal-state-notifications'
Fix #930 - ClassCastException in WPAlertDialogFragment
Fix #247 - status icon should show error
fix #938: check hasActivity in onPostExecute to avoid a npe
move hasActivity()

Merge pull request #940 from wordpress-mobile/issue/938-npe-while-uploading-from-photos-app

fix #938: check hasActivity in onPostExecute to avoid a npe

- Do not get the video mimeType from MimeTypeMap if it was already set in the cursor.
- When both cursor and MimeTypeMap fail to retrieve the mimeType, try to guess it by using URLConnection.
- When all of the previous method fail, set an empty mimeType.

Moved the code that retrieves the mimeType of a Media File to a utility method.

We can't live without mimeType.
Just renamed a variable
fix #943: add default dimens for theme dialog in case Utils.isXLarge() returns true even if the device width is < 720dp
Make sure the file has an extension, otherwise WordPress (server) can't match the mime type by using the filename provided in the request.

Fix #945 - extra protection to ensure we don't request more notes before the fragment's view has been created. Also optimized adding/clearing notes to avoid calling notifyDataSetChanged() more often than necessary.
fix #944: use long instead of int for comment ids
Split 'getMediaFilenameAndMimeType' in 2 different functions.
Fix an issue where 'getMediaFileMimeType(File mediaFile, boolean isImage)' is called with false on images

fix #943: add default dimens for theme dialog

Treat int or i4 as a long if they can't be parsed as 4 bytes int - in XmlSerializer.deserialize

fix #944: use long instead of int for comment ids

Catch Internal server errors, and try to show a better error message to the user.

Added isFinishing() check before showing Toast on failure
Now making sure blog is valid before loading comments
onBlogChanged() is now called when all blogs are hidden
Improve error messages. Do not rewrite the error if we're not 100% of the root douse of the problem.
